FuncDef:
The access ipv6-address slot-warning-threshold command configures upper and lower IPv6 address alarm thresholds for service boards.
The undo access ipv6-address slot-warning-threshold command restores the default configuration.
By default, the IPv6 address usage threshold-crossing alarm is not enabled on a board.
CLIs: undo access ipv6-address slot-warning-threshold upper-limit <integer-value> lower-limit <integer-value>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a lower alarm threshold.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 99.

Specifies an upper alarm threshold.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 100.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure upper and lower IPv6 address alarm thresholds for service boards, run the access ipv6-address slot-warning-threshold command. When the percentage of the number of IPv6 addresses of access users on a service board in the IPv6 specification for the board exceeds the upper alarm threshold or goes below the lower alarm threshold, the device generates an alarm for the board.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
